content.description: Short fun problem that makes you some what mantle twice. Sit start with matching hands on jug. The feet are okay. Right and Left Arete are off if you want it to be fun.
content.location: To the right of Lay into it.    On backside of boulder.

content.description: Good warm up for stretching the legs. Traverse right to left on nice sloping feet. Hands on long rail that goes throughout the problem. Top out at point on left arete.
content.location: To the right of Wormy and to the left of High Tip

content.description: Sustained thin holds, easy to chimney
Start on low matching hand. move to two small out right and left then make a big move to a high center  sloper. Top out.
content.location: When you get to the boulder go down in between the boulder and mesquite tree. Rattle Shaker is to the right of Corn Flake.

content.description: Lay back start on two crimps. Use same feet as Wormy. Make one big move to jug. Then top out.
content.location: Start is to the right of Emerge and directly to the left of Wormy. It's the left Arete on Wormy.

content.description: It is a good slab problem with okay sloping crimps. The start requires a high foot. Try not to use the flake to the right. Top out to right
content.location: When you first walk up to the boulder you can walk down into an area that is between the boulder and a mesquite tree. High Tip is all the way to the left when facing the boulder.

content.description: Thin start moving right to the big rail, than easy moves on big cracks with good feet. Pulled a 300 pound  5 foot section off  on first try.  so the rock has a tendency to just fall apart be aware
content.location: The boulder is 5 feet off the mountain bike trail that runs through the area. Stands alone, 2 miles from parking area off of 51st ave

content.description: Short but powerful problem. Start down low under boulder. Hands are wide on two crimps. Feet are on nice ledge under boulder. It is mostly under hung. Top out.
content.location: To the right of Rattle Shake under small boulder and Den Boulder.

content.description: Start on a big flake to the right of High Tip. Feet are bad but hands are awesome. Start is slightly over hung. Top out.
content.location: When you get to the boulder go down and in between the boulder and mesquite tree. When facing the tree the boulder is right in the middle.

content.description: This boulder is Granite and pretty shape. It supports problems from V-easy to V3. There are plenty of fun features on the Den Boulder. Great warm up.
